METS:xmlData.dcterms:abstract: Sistem ohranjanja in razvijanja revolucionarnih izročil je bil ideološki mehanizem, ki je s kultnimi obrazci prikrival zločine in neuspehe Komunistične partije/Zveze komunistov Slovenije/Jugoslavije. Konec 2. svetovne vojne ne pomeni osvoboditve, ampak nadaljevanje boljševistične agresije (razredno, etnično, versko, kulturno »čiščenje«). V maju in juniju 1945 so pomorili več kot en odstotek prebivalstva Slovenije. Pod geslom bratstva in enotnosti pride do rasistične delitve živih in mrtvih, enopartijske diktature in kršenja temeljnih človekovih pravic. Brez pravice do groba in spomina je ostala skoraj polovica od okoli 90.000 smrtnih žrtev vojne in revolucije. Vlogo boga prevzame diktator Josip Broz Tito. Zgrajena je bila nova simbolna krajina. Neodvisna Republika Slovenija je po letu 1991 sprejela številne ukrepe za preseganje bremen preteklosti, zakonski in drugi ukrepi pa so predmet intenzivnih javnih, političnih in strokovnih razprav.

The system of maintaining and developing revolutionary traditions was an ideological mechanism that, with the help of cult forms, concealed the crimes and failures of the Yugoslav Communist Party and the League of Communists of Slovenia/Yugoslavia. Rather than liberation, the end of the Second World War denoted the continuation of the Bolshevik aggression, manifested in class, ethnic, religious and cultural »cleansing«. More than one percent of the entire Slovene population was murdered in May and June 1945. Under the slogan of »brotherhood and unity« stood for racist division of the living and the dead, one-party dictatorship, and violation of human rights were perpetrated. Almost one half of approximately 90,000 Slovene victims of war and revolution were denied their own grave and the right to be remembered. The role of god was taken over by dictator Josip Broz Tito. New political symbolism was constructed in this period. After 1991, the newly-independent Republic of Slovenia took measures for overcoming the heavy burden of the past, with legal measures and other provisions being the subject of heated public, politicai, and expert debates.
